conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road. Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure. It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
For car A, from t = 0 to 10 s it accelerates uniformly up to 40 m/s (straight line from the origin to 40 m/s). From t = 10 s onward it travels at the constant speed 40 m/s.
For car B, it accelerates uniformly from the origin so that its speed is 40 m/s at t = 20 s, and it continues to accelerate with the same slope beyond that time (straight line through the origin).

premise: For car A, from t = 0 to 10 s it accelerates uniformly up to 40 m/s.
conclusion: Acceleration of A from 0–10 s: a_A = Δv/Δt = 40 m/s / 10 s = 4 m/s².

premise: For car B, it accelerates uniformly from the origin so that its speed is 40 m/s at t = 20 s.
conclusion: Acceleration of B (slope of its straight line): a_B = 40 m/s / 20 s = 2 m/s².

premise: For car A, from t = 0 to 10 s it accelerates uniformly up to 40 m/s.
conclusion: Displacement of Car A from 0–10 s: s_A(0–10) = ½ × (10 s) × (40 m/s) = 200 m.

premise: For car B, it accelerates uniformly from the origin so that its speed is 40 m/s at t = 20 s.
conclusion: Displacement of Car B from 0–10 s: s_B(0–10) = ½ × (10 s) × (20 m/s) = 100 m.

premise: Displacement of Car A from 0–10 s: 200 m. Displacement of Car B from 0–10 s: 100 m.
conclusion: At t = 10 s car A has travelled 100 m more than car B and is ahead of car B.
